Detailed Description

A basic camera.

This is the basic camera implementation for DAZ Studio. It supplies commonly-used features like focal length adjustment and depth of field alteration.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzBasicCamera::DzBasicCamera ( DzCamera::CameraType  type = DzCamera::PERSPECTIVE_CAMERA,
bool  isViewCamera = false 
)

Create a camera of the given type. If isViewCam is true, then the camera will be non-animatable.

Parameters:
type The type of the camera
isViewCamera If true, the camera is a view camera - that is, it only exists as a camera for the purpose of viewing the scene, but is not a member of the scene. If false, the camera is a normal camera that is a member of the scene.
Example:
    // Create a new orthographic camera that looks forward on the Z axis.
    DzCamera    *cam = new DzBasicCamera( DzCamera::FRONT_CAMERA );

    // Name the camera and add it to the scene
    cam->setName( "My Camera" );
    dzScene->addNode( cam );
DzBasicCamera::~DzBasicCamera (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

DzBasicCamera::DzBasicCamera ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [protected]

For internal use only.

This constructor is called by the Framework when loading from a file so that certain initializations can be skipped that will happen later in the file load process.

Parameters:
file The file from which this object was loaded.

int  y 
) const [virtual, slot]

Parameters:

Returns:

DzVec3 DzBasicCamera::cursorToScene ( int  x,
int  y,
float  z 
) const [virtual, slot]

Calculates a location in the scene based on an x, y position in the viewport and distance from the camera.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate of the cursor in the viewport
y The y coordinate of the cursor in the viewport
z The distance from the camera in world space at which to calculate the target point.
Returns:
A positional vector that represents the resulting location in the scene.

void DzBasicCamera::setDepthOfField ( bool  useDOF  )  [virtual]

Sets whether or not Depth of Field is applied for the camera.

Parameters:
useDOF If true, depth of field calculations will be performed for this camera. If false, no depth of field calculations are done, and the entire scene is in focus.

int  height,
const QRect &  view,
int  pass = 0,
int  totalPasses = 1,
bool  depthOfField = false 
) [virtual]

Sets up the camera projection for OpenGL rendering

Parameters:

height The height of the viewport
view The rectangle defining the area displayed in the viewport
pass The current rendering pass in multipass operations
totalPasses The total number of passes for the rendering operation
depthOfField Whether or not to perform depth of field calculations

Implements DzCamera.

void DzBasicCamera::setPerspective ( bool  onOff  ) 

Sets whether or not the camera is a perspective view.

Parameters:
onOff If true, this will become a perspective camera, if false, it will become an orthographic camera.
Example:
    // Get an iterator for the selected cameras in the scene
    DzCameraIterator    camIt = dzScene->getSelectedCameras();
    DzCamera            *cam;

    // Toggle the selected cameras between perspective and orthographic mode
    for( cam = camIt->toFirst(); cam; cam = ++camIt ){
        if( cam->inherits( "DzBasicCamera" ) ){
            ((DzBasicCamera*)cam)->setPerspective( !((DzBasicCamera*)cam)->isPerspective() );
        }
    }
See also:
isPerspective()

float  width,
float  height 
) const [virtual]

Sets up the camera projection for rendering via the RenderMan interface.

Parameters:

Implements DzCamera.

void DzBasicCamera::setType ( DzCamera::CameraType  type  )  [slot]

Changes the type of the camera.

Parameters:
type The new type for the camera.
Example:
    DzMainWindow    *mw = dzApp->getInterface();

    if( mw ){
        // Get the active camera from the active viewport
        DzCamera    *cam = mw->getViewportMgr()->getActiveViewport()->get3DViewport()->getActiveCamera();

        if( cam->inherits( "DzBasicCamera" ) ){
            // If the camera is a basic camera, make it a perspective view.
            ((DzBasicCamera*)cam)->setType( DzCamera::PERSPECTIVE_CAMERA );
        }
    }

Property Documentation

bool DzBasicCamera::isPerspective [read, write]
Returns:
true if this is a perspective camera, false if it's an orthographic camera
See also:
setPerspective()
